newsitem.title: UK: BSkyB down as Merrill cuts to "neutral".
newsitem.headline: BSkyB down as Merrill cuts to "neutral".

text.p: Shares in British Sky Broadcasting Plc fell on Friday after analysts at Merrill Lynch cut the stock to "neutral" from "accumulate," market sources said.
The stock was down 14-1/2p at 565 by 1035 GMT in volume of 1.7 million shares.

Market sources said BSkyB had reached Merrill's price target having climbed steadily from its five-month low of 473p set December 13. Merrill expects the company's earnings per share to be flat at 13.6p in the year ending June 1997, unchanged on the year before, and to drop to 12.7p in fiscal 1998, sources said.
Merrill analysts were not immediately available for comment.
